block.p: Susan Catherine Hockings, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Eric F. Hockings of Princeton, N.J., was married yesterday to Thomas Joseph Kappock IV, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Kappock III of Hillsborough, Calif. The Rev. Jean R. Smith performed the ceremony at Trinity Episcopal Church in Princeton.

The couple received Ph.D.'s in chemistry from Yale, where they met. The bride, 31, was until last month a postdoctoral research associate at the University of Leicester in England, where she conducted enzyme research. In November she is to become a fellow in biochemistry at the Washington University School of Medicine in St. Louis, where the bridegroom, 32, is an assistant professor of chemistry, also specializing in biochemistry.

Susan Catherine Hockings, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Eric F. Hockings of Princeton, N.J., was married yesterday to Thomas Joseph Kappock IV, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Kappock III of Hillsborough, Calif. The Rev. Jean R. Smith performed the ceremony at Trinity Episcopal Church in Princeton.

The couple received Ph.D.'s in chemistry from Yale, where they met. The bride, 31, was until last month a postdoctoral research associate at the University of Leicester in England, where she conducted enzyme research. In November she is to become a fellow in biochemistry at the Washington University School of Medicine in St. Louis, where the bridegroom, 32, is an assistant professor of chemistry, also specializing in biochemistry.

Ms. Hockings, who is keeping her name, graduated cum laude from Carleton College in Northfield, Minn. Her father, a chemist, retired from the RCA Corporation's David Sarnoff Research Laboratory in Princeton, where he worked on research and development of television picture tubes. Her mother, Sarah C. Hockings, retired from the Philadelphia office of the FMC Corporation, a manufacturer of heavy equipment and agricultural chemicals, where she helped the company's researchers locate scientific information relating to their work.
Mr. Kappock, who is known as Joe, graduated from Northwestern University. His father is the chairman of NewMarkets International, an online financial services company in San Mateo, Calif.
